Title: Indices: Stock market update: Nifty Pharma index advances 0.91% in an upbeat market
Description: NEW DELHI: The Nifty Pharma index traded positive around 11:11AM(IST)on Monday in an upbeat market.Zydus Lifesciences(up 3.02 per cent), Divis Laboratories(up 2.82 per cent), Abbott India(up 2.59 per cent), Aurobindo Pharma(up 2.23 per cent) and Dr Reddys Laboratories(up 1.64 per cent) were among the top gainers.Gland Pharma(down 15.26 per cent), Glenmark Pharmaceuticals(down 3.89 per cent), Alkem Laboratories(down 1.78 per cent), Sanofi India(down 0.32 per cent) and Pfizer(down 0.12 per cent) were the top losers on the index.The Nifty Pharma index was up 0.91 per cent at 12234.8 at the time of writing this report.Benchmark NSE Nifty50 index was up 98.8 points at 18302.2, while the BSE Sensex was up 211.26 points at 61940.94.Among the 50 stocks in the Nifty index, 36 were trading in the green, while 14 were in the red.Shares of Zomato, PNB, Suzlon Energy Indian Railway Fin and YES Bank were among the most traded shares on the NSE.Shares of Refex Industries Jai Balaji Inds and IZMO hit their fresh 52-week highs in today's trade, while Gland Pharma, Sanwaria Consumer Balaji Amines , Gammon Infra and BKM Industries hit fresh 52-week lows in trade.

Title: Australia, India share stable, secure and prosperous Indo-Pacific: PM Albanese says ahead of Modi's visit
Description:
Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese on Monday said he is ''honoured'' to host Prime Minister Narendra Modi here and underlined that the two countries share a commitment to a stable, secure and prosperous Indo-Pacific.
Prime Minister Albanese also said that he looks forward to celebrating Australia’s vibrant Indian community with Prime Minister Modi in Sydney on Tuesday.
Prime Minister Modi will visit Australia from May 22-24 as a guest of the Australian Government.
“I am honoured to host Prime Minister Modi for an official visit to Australia, after receiving an extremely warm welcome in India earlier this year,'' Albanese said in a statement.
“Australia and India share a commitment to a stable, secure and prosperous Indo-Pacific.

Title: FPI buying in Indian shares hits 6-month high in first half of May: NSDL
Description:
In fact, FPIs bought Indian equities in each of the nine sessions in the first half of May.
The benchmark Nifty 50 jumped 1.85% in the first half of May, as FPI inflows powered the rise in domestic equities.
WHAT FPIs BOUGHT IN MAYAfter selling financial services shares worth 299.93 billion rupees in FY2023, FPIs have shown renewed interest in the sector, buying 83.82 billion rupees in May.
FPIs had bought 76.90 billion rupees in the sector in April.
Automobile, oil and gas, healthcare, and fast moving consumer goods also witnessed buying in May, while information technology saw selling.

Title: SBI vs Bank of Baroda vs Canara Bank: How India’s top PSU banks performed in Q4
Description:
India’s largest public sector lenders SBI, Bank of Baroda and Canara Bank delivered another quarter of robust growth in loans and deposits.
Despite delivering record profits in both Q3 and Q4 FY23, the SBI stock has underperformed over the last six months.
Canara Bank’s shares, however, have fallen 6% in this time.
It also has a better net interest margin (NIM), but its provision coverage ratio (PCR) is slightly lower than the other two banks.
Canara Bank’s cost of deposit rose 19 basis points to 4.38%.

Title: Rupee opens 13 paise lower at 82.79 against US dollar
Description:
The Indian rupee opened lower Monday after the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) central bank said it will withdraw the ₹2,000 denomination currency notes from circulation.
The local unit opened 13 paise lower at 82.79 against the US dollar as compared to its Friday's close of 82.66 per dollar.
The dollar index traded lower following a surprise breakdown in US debt ceiling negotiations and after Federal Reserve chair Jerome Powell indicated a preference to slow rate hikes.
Last week, the rupee fell 0.6% to 82.66 per dollar on the back of a rise in the dollar index and Treasury yields.
The dollar index surged over 2% in the past two weeks.

Title: Six entities under lens for suspicious trading in Adani shares: SC panel, ET EnergyWorld
Description:
AdvtAdvtJoin the community of 2M+ industry professionals Subscribe to our newsletter to get latest insights & analysis.
Enter Email Download ETEnergyworld App Get Realtime updatesSave your favourite articles Scan to download AppNew Delhi: Six entities including four foreign portfolio investors (FPIs) are under lens for suspicious trading in Adani group shares prior to the release of the damning Hindenburg report, the Supreme Court-appointed expert committee has said.
"While there was no adverse observation with respect to Adani scips in the cash segment, suspicious trading has been observed on the part of six entities.
These are four FPIs, one body corporate and one individual," the report said.The report did not name any of the six.
"The trading pattern here is suspicious because of the build up of short positions by these entities in the Adani scrips prior to the Hindenburg report, and substantial profits earned by them by squaring off their short positions after publication of the Hindenburg report on January 24, 2023," the expert committee said.A detailed investigation is being carried out in respect of the trading of the six entities.

Our revised target price is Rs 675 (earlier: Rs 550) on an unchanged multiple of 6.2x FY25E EBITDA.

Title: Six Entities Including Foreign Investors Under Lens For Suspicious Trading In Adani Group Shares, Says SC Panel
Description:
HomeBusinessSix Entities Including Foreign Investors Under Lens For Suspicious Trading In Adani Group Shares, Says SC PanelSix Entities Including Foreign Investors Under Lens For Suspicious Trading In Adani Group Shares, Says SC PanelSimply put, a "short" position is the sale of a stock that one does not own.
Six Entities Including Foreign Investors Under Lens For Suspicious Trading In Adani Group Shares, Says SC Panel (Image: ANI)New Delhi: Four foreign portfolio investors (FPIs) and two other entities are under lens for suspicious trading in Adani group shares prior to the release of the damning Hindenburg report, the Supreme Court-appointed expert committee has said.
“While there was no adverse observation with respect to Adani scips in the cash segment, suspicious trading has been observed on the part of six entities.
A detailed investigation is being carried out in respect of the trading of the six entities.
After a detailed scrutiny of the movement of prices of Adani shares and their sale and purchase by different entities, the committee found no evidence of price manipulation of stocks by firms linked to the Adani group.

Title: India's note withdrawal to improve liquidity, ease short-term rates - analysts
Description:
The value of such notes in circulation is 3.6 trillion rupees ($44.02 billion).
Kotak Institutional Equities estimates that liquidity could improve by around 1 trillion rupees, while QuantEco Research pegs the potential liquidity impact at 400 billion rupees to 1.1 trillion rupees.
ICICI Securities Primary Dealership estimates the liquidity surplus could increase to 1.5-2 trillion rupees.
India's banking system liquidity surplus has averaged around 600 billion rupees so far in May.
About 2.5-3 trillion rupees of banking sector liquidity leaks out as currency in circulation each year, said Pranjul Bhandari, chief India economist at HSBC.

Title: UK Opposition Slams Donations To Conservative Party By Indian Businessman
Description:
Karan Chanana is under investigation by the ED for fraud and money laundering.
(File)Britain's Opposition Labour Party is calling for a freeze on the money donated by an Indian rice tycoon to the governing Conservative Party while he is under investigation by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) in India on fraud and money laundering allegations.
He is believed to have donated around GBP 220,000 to the Conservatives through his British company Amira G. Foods since September 2019.
Amira Nature Foods was listed on the New York stock exchange in October 2012, specialising in Indian basmati rice grown in the foothills of the Himalayas.
Its subsidiaries included Amira Pure Foods in India, now under investigation, and Amira G. Foods in the UK, according to corporate filings.

Title: Market LIVE Updates: Indices trade higher, Nifty at 18,300; Adani group stocks most active
Description:
May 22, 2023 / 11:33 AM ISTThe Power Transmission & Distribution (PT&D) Business of Larsen & Toubro (L&T) construction has recently secured EPC orders in India and overseas.
In the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia (KSA), the Business has secured two orders to establish 380kV overhead power transmission lines connecting prominent cities situated on the Red Sea coast.
Another order has been secured to design, supply, and construct a 380kV substation in the central region of KSA.
The substation will be a crucial element to evacuate renewable capacity as part of the Kingdom’s diversification to non-fossil fuel sources in their electricity mix.
Larsen & Toubro was quoting at Rs 2,214.85, up Rs 24.55, or 1.12 percent on the BSE.

Title: Financial bulletins are the stuff of memes on Twitter
Description:
At first, it was about TCS (not the Tata company).
Then came ‘ Note Bandi 2.0.’ And just like that, a meme fest ensued on ‘ Fintwit ,’ or Financial Twitter , late last week.“Typically, there is one development a week in the financial sector that is ripe for meme makers to lap up.
They posted screenshots from popular web series such as Mirzapur and Sacred Games, as well as recent ones such as Farzi and The Night Manager (the Indian version).
They are relatively newer in the Indian context, but at this point, almost every piece of news gets memefied, he said.Earlier, static memes were widely popular on Fintwit.
However, “since both TCS and Rs 2,000 note discontinuation weren’t complicated matters, they didn’t lead to many video memes,” he said.

Description:

According to data from NSDL, FPIs have pumped ₹15,516 crore in financial services stocks alone since March.

Title: Six entities under lens for suspicious trading in Adani shares, says SC panel
Description:
Six entities including four foreign portfolio investors (FPIs) are under lens for suspicious trading in Adani group shares prior to the release of the damning Hindenburg report , the Supreme Court-appointed expert committee has said.
Shares of Adani Group, which denied all allegations, likening the US investment firm's report to an attack on India, fell after the Hindenburg report was published on January 24.
"While there was no adverse observation with respect to Adani scips in the cash segment, suspicious trading has been observed on the part of six entities.
A detailed investigation is being carried out in respect of the trading of the six entities.
After a detailed scrutiny of the movement of prices of Adani shares and their sale and purchase by different entities, the committee found no evidence of price manipulation of stocks by firms linked to the Adani group.

Title: India, UK review FTA progress
Description:
The two leaders reviewed their Comprehensive Strategic Partnership, including taking stock of the progress in India-UK FTA negotiations.
They had earlier met on the margins of the G20 summit in Indonesia in November last year.
Sunak is slated to attend the G20 summit in India in September this year.
“The leaders agreed that their teams would continue to work at pace to finalise an ambitious and mutually beneficial deal,” said Sunak’s spokesperson.
“The leaders discussed the wider objectives of the G7 summit and the PM (Sunak) committed his strong support for India’s G20 presidency,” added the spokesperson.

Title: Karnataka: Anna Bhagya scheme to fix malnutrition
Description:
Mohammed Yacoob ByExpress News ServiceBENGALURU: The government will not go back on its word on implementation of Anna Bhagya scheme, where every BPL (Below Poverty Line) household will be given 10kg of free grains.
Vasudev Sharma, Executive Director, Child Rights Trust, said everyone welcomes such a scheme, and contended that almost all governments have worked for food security.
Even though food is available, the issue of malnutrition is not addressed, especially among children and adolescent girls.
To fight malnutrition, it is necessary to have such a scheme.
BENGALURU: The government will not go back on its word on implementation of Anna Bhagya scheme, where every BPL (Below Poverty Line) household will be given 10kg of free grains.

Title: There’s optimism in the country and it’s seeping through the system: HSBC India CEO Hitendra Dave
Description:
HSBC India’s Chief Executive Officer HITENDRA DAVE says he is bullish on India despite a host of problems across the global economy.
I am very optimistic about India… I don’t think I have been this bullish ever.
I don’t think the resilience or the shock-absorbing cushion is getting captured in widespread narratives.
I don’t think there are talks of rate cuts in yield curves either in the West or in India.
Both on a relative and absolute basis, we think India is the place for any bank, particularly for a global bank like us, to make a very significant mark.

Title: Stock Market Today: All You Need To Know Going Into Trade On May 22
Description:
Contracts for the S&P 500 and the Nasdaq 100 dropped about 0.2% after the gauges registered small declines on Friday.
At 5:38 a.m., the Singapore-traded SGX Nifty, an early indicator of the Nifty 50 Index’s performance in India, was down 0.16% at 18,209.5.
Domestic benchmark indices snapped a three-day losing streak to end higher, aided by gains in Adani Group stocks as well as technology and information technology stocks.
Foreign portfolio investors offloaded equities worth Rs 113.46 crore, snapping the 16-day buying streak—the longest buying spree so far in 2023.
On the other hand, domestic institutional investors turned buyers snapping their three-day selling streak, and bought stocks worth Rs 1,071.35 crore, the NSE data showed.

Title: UK Opposition Calls for Freeze of Indian Rice Tycoon's Donation to Conservative Party
Description:
Britain’s Opposition Labour Party is calling for a freeze on the money donated by an Indian rice tycoon to the governing Conservative Party while he is under investigation by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) in India on fraud and money laundering allegations.
Karan Chanana, head of the global rice brand Amira, is being investigated by ED over claims that bank loans were unlawfully diverted into shell entities and is yet to respond to the allegations.
He is believed to have donated around GBP 220,000 to the Conservatives through his British company Amira G. Foods since September 2019.
Amira Nature Foods was listed on the New York stock exchange in October 2012, specialising in Indian basmati rice grown in the foothills of the Himalayas.
top videosIts subsidiaries included Amira Pure Foods in India, now under investigation, and Amira G. Foods in the UK, according to corporate filings.

Title: Onion seed growers enjoying bumper yields
Description:
PHOTO: Suzit Kumar DasOnion seed farmers in Faridpur, a major growing district in southern Bangladesh, are enjoying bumper yields this year as the weather was favourable during cultivation, according to market players.
During a recent visit to the Ambikapur area of Faridpur sadar upazila, this correspondent found that onion seed growers are busy preparing their harvest for sale.
"I hope to get at least 45 maunds of onion seed to make up for last year's loss," he added.
Mostafa Biswas, another local farmer, said they would not face such problems if the government avoids buying onion seed from abroad.
"Onion farmers will get good yields this year due to favourable weather and hopefully, prices will be good also," he added.

Trust Islami Life Insurance, CAPM IBBL Islamic Mutual Fund, Emerald Oil Industries, and Global Insurance Company were among the top gainers.

Title: Global sugar prices may go up as Indian output drops
Description:
The Indian government has capped exports for the ongoing sugar production cycle, which runs from October to September each year, at 6.1 million tonnes.
According to the association, 5.7 million tonnes of the permitted quota have already been exported, with the remainder expected to be shipped out by May 25.
The country was expected to produce around 38.5 million tonnes in 2022-23, but this estimate was lowered to 36.8 million tonnes by the Indian Sugar Mills Association (Isma) on April 26.
In April, ex-mill sugar prices shot up by 300 rupees (S$4.80) to 3,590-3,750 rupees a quintal in Uttar Pradesh.
The supply crunch in India comes as global sugar prices are on an upswing.

Title: Market regulator pushes for anti-avoidance provisions
Description:
Mumbai: Markets regulator Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi) is pitching for anti-avoidance provisions which will enable the regulator to go after corporates devising innovative arrangements to avoid compliance with the share market rules.
Hence, the markets regulator urged the committee to recommend creation of anti-avoidance provisions that give Sebi powers to go after entities looking to avoid complying with the law, the committee report showed.
Even the Indian tax department has such a power which is covered under General Anti-Avoidance Rules (GAAR).
Now, Sebi wants a similar provision which will enable the regulator to crack down on related party transactions, insider trading and other potential market violations.
“Sebi submitted to the committee that the committee ought to recommend introduction of provisions akin to the general anti-avoidance rules that are now in vogue in tax laws."

Title: Asian indices increases, Indian Sensex index declines on Thursday
Description:
(MENAFN) Nearly every main Asian index ended Thursday’s session with increases, whereas the Indian Sensex index dropped marginally by 0.17 percent.
The Asia Dow, which contains blue-chip firms in the area, grew 1.27 percent to 3,443.78 points as of 1000GMT.
On Thursday, Japan's official numbers indicated that the nation’s shipments surged by 2.6 percent whereas shipments into the nation fell by 2.3 percent in April.
China's Shanghai Stock Exchange also surged 0.4 percent to 3,297.32 points, whereas the Singapore index jumped by 0.27 percent to finish the session reaching 3,182.55 points.
In the meantime, India's Sensex index saw a fall of 0.17 percent to end standing at 61,458.83.

Title: That’s why India is withdrawing Rs 2,000 notes Pipa News
Description:
That’s why India is withdrawing Rs 2,000 notesThat’s why India is withdrawing Rs 2,000 notes.
The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has asked people to deposit Rs 2,000 denomination notes before September 30 or exchange them with other bank notes as the central bank announced its plan to withdraw these notes, media reported.
However, it has said that its directions on Rs 2,000 notes will remain in effect till that date.
When the Rs 2000 notes were introduced, they were intended to replenish the Indian currency in circulation immediately after demonetisation.
The value of Rs 2,000 notes in circulation is 3.62 trillion Indian rupees ($44.27 billion).

PM Modi arrived in Japan on Friday for the annual summit of the G7 grouping and the third in-person Quad leaders' meeting.
Members of the Indian community had said they were "extremely excited" to have the Prime Minister among them.
PM Modi was also seen interacting individually with world leaders such as US President Joe Biden, Australia Prime Minister Anthony Albanese, and Japan Prime Minister Fumio Kishida.

Title: India to withdraw 2,000-rupee notes from circulation
Description:
NEW DELHI: India will start withdrawing its highest-value currency notes from circulation, its central bank said on Friday, in a move that economists said could boost bank deposits at a time of high credit growth.
Announcing the withdrawal, the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) said evidence showed the denomination was not being commonly used for transactions.
The 2,000 rupee note was introduced in 2016 after the Narendra Modi-led government abruptly withdrew 500 and 1000 rupee denominations in an effort to remove forgeries from circulation.
The government began issuing new 500 rupee notes days later and added the 2,000 to replenish currency in circulation at a faster pace.
However, since then, the central bank has focused on printing notes of 500 rupees and below and has printed no new 2,000-rupee notes in the last four years.

Title: Hindenburg saga: Four FPIs under SEBI scanner for Adani share price crash
Description:
A report from US-based obscure short-seller Hindenburg Research on January 24 unleashed a wave of short bets on Adani Group companies, leading to a stock rout that crashed the conglomerate’s market valuation by more than $125 billion.
“It is noteworthy that strong feedback on the Hindenburg Report is that it contained no new data but was substantially a collection of inferences from data in the public domain.
The Committee is equally cognizant of the fact that the allegations in the Hindenburg Report are substantially based on publicly available information.
However, the manner in which it has extrapolated the information and presented it, has led to a serious nose-dive in the prices of Adani stocks,” the expert committee has noted in its recent report.
Hindenburg itself had revealed that it “held short positions in Adani companies through bonds and non-Indian-traded derivative instruments.”

Title: Foreign Investors Flock To Indian Market, Invest Rs 30,945 Crore Into Equities So Far in May | Key Driving Factors
Description:
Foreign Investors (Image Source: Pixabay)Data indicates a positive development for the Indian economy , as foreign investors have infused Rs 30,945 crore into the Indian equities during May.
This surge in foreign investments signifies growing confidence in the Indian market and highlights the attractiveness of Indian equities among international investors.
In addition to their investments in equities, foreign portfolio investors (FPIs) have also allocated Rs 1,057 crore towards the debt market thus far in May.
This follows a net infusion of Rs 11,630 crore in equities during April and Rs 7,936 crore in March.
These investment trends highlight the growing interest of foreign investors in Indian financial markets, encompassing both equities and debt instruments.

Title: Modi-Zelenskyy’s Hiroshima Rendezvous: India must help Ukraine and recalibrate its strategic calculations in light of the Russia-China compact
Description:
For, the Ukraine war has severely diminished Russia’s international stock.
In fact, even China is supporting Russia because of its own strategic-security calculations, not because it agrees with Moscow’s Ukraine expedition.
Russia needs to be condemned for the invasion of Ukraine, it must be made to face penalties, and Ukraine needs to be supported materially, financially and militarily to regain full control of its internationally recognised borders.
It must also increase the level of bilateral cooperation and promise assistance in rebuilding Ukraine after the war ends.
With Russia and China practically inseparable now, New Delhi must revise its strategic calculations.

Title: PM asks global community to raise voice against status quo
Description:
Underlining the need for all countries to respect the UN Charter, international law and sovereignty and territorial integrity of other nations, Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday asked the global community to jointly raise its voice against unilateral attempts to change the status quo.
Modi said global peace, stability, and prosperity were the common objectives of the global community.
In the current global situation, these countries are facing the maximum and most profound impact of the food, fuel, and fertilizer crisis,” he added.
He said the current situation raised the question as to why the world community was facing the need to discuss matters of peace and stability in distinct forums.
Before leaving on the second leg of his current three-nation tour, Modi also met UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak.

Title: Manipur: Security forces ensuring truck movement with essentials
Description:
Manipur: Security forces ensuring truck movement with essentialsVartha Bharati | 21-05-2023 | 16:44:00 ISTPC: PTIImphal (PTI): Trucks carrying essential commodities to violence-hit Manipur are plying with special security cover to ensure that there is no shortage of goods in the Northeastern state, a defence spokesperson said on Sunday.
The Army and Assam Rifles along with the state government, Manipur Police and central armed police forces are working to provide protection to vehicles carrying such goods to and from Imphal via NH 37, the defence spokesperson said.
To guarantee dedicated security, vehicles are also accompanied by Quick Reaction Teams of the Manipur Police and CRPF, he added.
Movement of trucks on NH 37 commenced on May 15 and security forces remain committed to restoring complete normalcy, the spokesperson said.

Title: Transworld Holdings plans voluntary delisting of Shreyas Shipping
Description:
Transworld Holdings plans to voluntarily delist equity shares of its Indian subsidiary, Shreyas Shipping & Logistics, through a reverse book-building process.
The delisting price will be determined through the reverse book-building mechanism in the Delisting Regulations.
Public shareholders of SSL will get an opportunity to realise immediate and certain value for their equity shares, said the company.
Transworld Holdings along with its affiliates hold 1,54,66,650 equity shares aggregating to 70.44 per cent of the paid-up equity share capital of SSL.
Transworld Holdings has to buy back at least 90 per cent of SSL’s total equity shares to delist from the exchange.

Title: RBI withdrew Rs 2,000 banknote from Circulation; Exchange/Deposit until September 30, 2023
Description:
On May 19, 2023, the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) notified the withdrawal of Rs 2000 denomination banknotes from circulation and directed banks to stop issuing this banknote with immediate effect.
Legal Tender Status will be continued:While the Rs 2000 banknotes will no longer be issued or circulated after September 30, 2023, they will still be considered legal tender after this too.
For transactions, the individuals can continue to use the Rs 2000 banknotes upto September 30, 2023, but are encouraged to exchange/deposit within the given time frame.
ii.Concluding Timeframe: Approximately 89% of the Rs 2000 banknotes were put into circulation before March 2017.
Additional info: The Magenta coloured Rs 2000 note was a part of the Mahatma Gandhi New Series of banknotes.

Title: Suspicious trading by 6 entities in Adani shares before Hindenburg report: SC panel
Description:
Panel finds build-up of short positions in Adani scrips by six entities right before Hindenburg report, and substantial profits earned by them after the stocks crashedSix entities, including four foreign portfolio investors (FPIs), are under lens for suspicious trading in Adani Group shares just before the damning Hindenburg report was released, the Supreme Court-appointed expert committee has said.
Investors who sell short believe the stock price will decrease in value.
The shares of Adani Group, which denied all allegations, nosedived after the Hindenburg report was published.
“While there was no adverse observation with respect to Adani scrips in the cash segment, suspicious trading has been observed on the part of six entities.
Suspicious trading pattern“The trading pattern here is suspicious because of the build-up of short positions by these entities in the Adani scrips prior to the Hindenburg report, and substantial profits earned by them by squaring off their short positions after publication of the Hindenburg report on January 24, 2023,” the expert committee said.

Title: Challenge to fight powers inciting social & communal divide; Karnataka results show situation changing: Pawar
Description:
Challenge to fight powers inciting social & communal divide; Karnataka results show situation changing: PawarA A APTI, May 21, 2023, 3:19 PM ISTNationalist Congress party (NCP) president Sharad Pawar on Sunday said the challenge before everyone is to fight powers that are deliberately inciting social and communal divide in the country.
The results of the recently held Assembly elections in Karnataka show the situation is gradually changing, Pawar said at an event in Maharashtra’s Ahmednagar district.
If the working class remains strong and united, what was seen in the Karnataka Assembly polls can be replicated elsewhere in the country as well, he said.
The Karnataka Assembly poll results show the situation is gradually changing, Pawar said.

Title: UK Conservative Party faces calls to freeze money donated by Indian rice tycoon Karan Chanana » Yes Punjab
Description:
- Advertisement -New Delhi, May 21, 2023- The UK Conservative Party is facing calls this weekend to freeze the money donated by Indian rice tycoon Karan Chanana, pending an inquiry, a media report said.
“It was also known that Karan Chanana had donated to a political party of [the] United Kingdom since 2019 ….
Its subsidiaries included Amira Pure Foods in India, now under investigation, and Amira G Foods in the UK, according to corporate filings.
Amira G Foods, controlled by Chanana, donated 222,104 Pounds to the Conservative party between September 2019 and December 2021.
Amira Pure Foods in India is now under liquidation, The Guardian reported.

Title: Large cap speciality chemical stock fixes record date for 350% dividend, LIC held 1.40% stake in Q4
Description:
Navin Fluorine International is a large cap commodity chemical company that recorded a market cap of ₹22,617.47 Cr during Friday's closing session.
Navin Fluorine International Ltd (NFIL) is a prominent and well-known Indian manufacturer of speciality fluorochemicals.
In order to determine the eligibility of the shareholders for the purpose of 350% dividend, the company has announced record date.
On Friday, the shares of Navin Fluorine International closed on the NSE at ₹4,535.60 apiece down by 1.82% from the previous close of ₹4,619.90.
As per the shareholding pattern of Navin Fluorine International for January to March 2023 quarter, insurance giant LIC held 6,94,859 fully paid up equity shares or 1.40% stake in the company.

Title: India regulator proposes halving IPO listing time
Description:
MUMBAI - India’s market regulator proposed halving the time needed to list shares on the nation's stock exchanges from the closure of initial public offerings (IPOs) to three days.
The proposed reduction in timelines for listing and trading of shares would benefit issuers and investors, the Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) said in a consultation paper on its website late on Saturday.
"Issuers will have faster access to the capital raised, thereby enhancing the ease of doing business, and the investors will have opportunity for having early credit and liquidity of their investments," SEBI said.
SEBI invited comments on the proposed change until June 3.
(Reporting by Jayshree P Upadhyay and M. Sriram; Editing by William Mallard)

Title: Here's why India is withdrawing 2,000-rupee notes
Description:
The RBI said banknotes of this denomination will continue to be legal tender which implies a consumer can purchase goods by these banknotes.
However, it has said that its instructions on the INR 2,000 notes will be effective until that date.
The 2000-rupee notes were introduced in November 2016, after withdrawal of legal tender status of all INR 500 and 1,000 banknotes by the Narendra Modi-led government.
The demonetisation of INR 500 and 1,000 notes had rattled the banking system as Indians flocked bank branches and ATMs to get their notes exchanged to legal tender.
The printing of 2,000 denomination notes was stopped in 2018-19, and they are no longer commonly seen with the public — unlike the ubiquitous INR 500 and 1,000 in 2016.

Title: Asian shares end Thursday’s session with earnings
Description:
(MENAFN) Nearly every main Asian index ended Thursday with earnings, whereas the Indian Sensex index dropped marginally by 0.17 percent.
The Asia Dow, which contains blue-chip firms in the area, surged 1.27 percent to reach 3,443.78 points as of 1000GMT.
Tokyo's Nikkei 225 rose 1.6 percent to end standing at 30,573.93 points.
The Hang Seng, the main for blue-chip shares exchange on the Hong Kong trading, was higher by 0.85 percent to stand at 19,727.25 points.
In the meantime, India's Sensex index dropped 0.17 percent to finish standing at 61,458.83.

Title: Rs. 2000 Notes, No Need To Press The Panic Button - Indian PSU
Description:
A majority of the Rs 2,000 denomination notes were issued prior to March 2017 and are at the end of their estimated life span of 4-5 years.
Members of the public can continue to use Rs 2000 notes for their transactions and also receive them in payment.
Is there an operational limit on the amount of Rs 2,000 banknotes that can be exchanged?
Members of the public can exchange Rs 2,000 banknotes up to a limit of Rs 20,000 at a time.
An exchange of Rs 2,000 banknotes can be made through BCs up to a limit of Rs 4,000 per day for an account holder.

Title: Adani probe will only produce heat, not light
Description:
It’s a suspicion the SEBI has investigated “for years before the Hindenburg report,” says the panel of experts.
Adani stocks rose after the report became public Friday.
In other words, even if Adani has violated the minimum 25 per cent public shareholding norm, the SEBI may never be able to prove it.
The SEBI has already asked Adani if investments by these foreign funds into his publicly traded companies have been funded by his group.
Minimum public shareholding was the most promising investigative lead among the three that the court had asked the SEBI to pursue.
